    <item>
      <title>Russian Insider Says State-Run Doping Fueled Olympic Gold</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/sports/russia-doping-sochi-olympics-2014.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/sports/russia-doping-sochi-olympics-2014.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/sports/russia-doping-sochi-olympics-2014.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/sports/13DOPINGweb01SUB/13DOPINGweb01SUB-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>The director of Russia’s antidoping laboratory at the time of the Sochi Games said urine samples were surreptitiously replaced by somehow breaking into supposedly tamper-proof bottles.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Tony Cenicola/The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>Each night, said the director of the antidoping lab at the Sochi Games, bottles of urine were passed through a hole in the wall and replaced for testing the next day.</description>
      <dc:creator>REBECCA R. RUIZ and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:50:24 GMT</pubDate>

      <title>Sports of The Times: Revelations of State-Backed Doping Should Bar Russia From Rio Olympics</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/sports/russias-doping-problem-is-an-open-secret-no-longer.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>

      <media:description>Craig Reedie, the World Anti-Doping Agency president, praised Russia’s efforts against performance-enhancing drugs in Sochi.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Graham Hughes/Canadian Press, via Associated Press</media:credit>
      <description>The stunningly complex doping scheme at the Sochi Olympics shows that long-whispered worries about Russian athletes cannot be ignored.</description>

    <item>
      <title>Man vs. Marathon</title>

      <media:description>The Dead Sea could be an ideal place to train a runner to complete a marathon in less than two hours, according to the scientist Yannis Pitsiladis, who did a test run along a dike there in February.</media:description>
